name: Dumbbell Curtsy Lunge
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Take your right leg and step it back and across your left leg, bending both knees as if performing a curtsy.
Lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor, keeping your torso upright.
Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side.

name: Ring Row
instructions: Adjust the rings to an appropriate height. Grab the rings with a neutral grip and lean back, keeping your body straight from head to heels.
Your arms should be fully extended. This is your starting position.
Pull your chest up toward the rings by bending your elbows and retracting your shoulder blades.
Keep your body straight throughout the movement.
Pause at the top, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Seal Row
instructions: Set up a bench on elevated platforms or boxes so you can lie face down with arms hanging straight down.
Grab a barbell or dumbbells with an overhand grip, arms fully extended toward the floor.
Pull the weight up toward your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Switch Jump
instructions: Start in a lunge position with one foot forward and one foot back, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
Explosively jump up, switching your legs in mid-air.
Land softly in a lunge position with the opposite leg forward.
Immediately jump again to switch legs.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Copenhagen Hold
instructions: Position yourself sideways next to a bench or elevated surface.
Place your top leg on the bench with your knee or foot, depending on difficulty level desired.
Keep your bottom leg extended and hovering above the ground.
Support your upper body with your forearm on the ground, maintaining a straight line from head to heels.
Hold this position, engaging your adductors and core.
Maintain the hold for the prescribed duration, then switch sides.

name: Cable Step Down
instructions: Stand on an elevated platform or box with one foot near the edge.
Hold a cable handle in one or both hands for added resistance.
Slowly lower your free leg toward the ground by bending the knee of the leg on the platform.
Control the descent, keeping your weight on the heel of your elevated foot.
Push through your heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions, then switch legs.

name: Dumbbell Row to Press
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Hinge at the hips and bend forward to approximately 45 degrees, keeping your back straight.
Pull the dumbbells up to your sides in a rowing motion, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
From the top of the row position, rotate the dumbbells and press them overhead.
Lower the dumbbells back down, reverse the movement, and return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Single Leg Deadlift to Stabilization
instructions: Stand on one leg holding a dumbbell in the opposite hand.
Keeping your back straight, hinge at the hip and lower the dumbbell toward the ground.
Extend your free leg behind you for balance, keeping your body in a straight line.
Lower until your torso is approximately parallel to the ground.
Hold the bottom position for 2-3 seconds to stabilize.
Drive through your standing heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: Dumbbell Side Lunge
instructions: Stand with your feet together, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Take a wide step to the side with your right leg.
Lower your body by bending your right knee and pushing your hips back, keeping your left leg straight.
Keep your chest up and your weight on your right heel.
Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side.
Alternate sides for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Alternating Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
Your palms should be facing forward with elbows bent at 90 degrees.
Press one dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended.
Lower that dumbbell back to shoulder height in a controlled manner.
As it descends, begin pressing the other dumbbell overhead.
Continue alternating arms for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Keep your core engaged throughout the movement to maintain stability.

name: Switch Jump to Kneeling Jump
instructions: Start in a lunge position with one foot forward and one foot back, both knees bent.
Explosively jump up, switching your legs in mid-air.
Land softly in a lunge position with the opposite leg forward.
After completing the switch jumps, transition to kneeling jumps.
From a kneeling position on both knees, explosively swing your arms and drive your hips forward to jump up to a standing position.
Land softly and return to the kneeling position.
Repeat the combination for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Cuban to Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding light dumbbells with an overhand grip.
Raise your elbows up to shoulder height with your upper arms parallel to the ground, forearms pointing down (like a goal post position).
Rotate your shoulders to bring the dumbbells up so your forearms point toward the ceiling, keeping your elbows at shoulder height.
From this position, press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Reverse the movement: lower the dumbbells back to the rotated position, then rotate back down.
Return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions, using controlled movements throughout.
